snippet: The siege of Amerli, a northern Shiite Turkmen community, is thought to be the first instance in which a town has kept ISIS at bay since the group began its march through Iraq.
abstract: Shiite Turkmens and fellow residents in Amerli, Iraq, are credited for their courage and success, waging weeks-long campaign for survival against Islamic State group that kept their town out of terrorist control; siege is thought to be first time town has kept militants out; ISIS fighters were eventually driven out by odd coalition of Iraqi and Iranian militias backed by American air support; aid from United Nations has started reaching starving residents.
lead_paragraph: The siege of Amerli, a northern Shiite Turkmen community, is thought to be the first instance in which a town has kept ISIS at bay since the group began its march through Iraq.
